page.title: 17PADFIELD VILLAGE - A POEM
page.content:
Padfield a village with three corners Quietly set out in the hills Filled with friendly people And the old grey mills.
There's the old chapel on Post Street And the small village school There's the Peels Arms pub on Temple Street Where people have a drink and play pool.
And there's the recreation ground Where the children like to play Some swings, a slide and a roundabout Just right for a summer's day.
So if you ever happen to be passing by Just have a stop and see The small village of Padfield And you'll have a happy memory. By Claire Hindley, Padfield CP School
